Patch Set 30: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 38ee9c8d8099e3364e8769c61d0647e39f4fc332
Please add why this change was required and a test section which explains step required to test this change.
Done
The flow does not looks correct. Need to revisit the code flow. Will review further post that.
Whis function is required? This is duplicating a lot of code.
Ack
Why this has been marked as in,out?
Ack
Same here, marked as in,out.
Ack
Use a better name, like systemRecKwdPairForBackup.
Ack
Use a constant reference.
Ack
To avoid this string copy can we have this checked in-place?
Ack
Why this piece of code is required?
above piece of code is not required, need to remove it
Ack
This information has already been extracted above. Why it is required again? Why the above value cant be re-used?
Ack
Do you still want to continue further if the system VPD format is invalid?
Ack
Why this code needs to be moved into a condition. This is a common code irrespective of system type.
Ack
This check is already there is populateDbus function. Can we branch off from there?
Ack
Can we avoid this copy as it is being only used at one place. Can we do this in place?
Ack
At this point the data is already in vector. Why this is re-required?
Ack
Same here, these codes are already executed above. Why we need to repeat?
Ack
The flow does not looks correct. Need to revisit the code flow. Will review further post that.
Ack
Why change of severity only required in case of ECC exception?
Ack
The explanation is not correct. Need to discuss.
Ack
posting whatever I have now. need to review manager code
Please update doxygen comments as per function arguments.
Ack
missing doxygen for jsonFile
Ack
where is the corresponding json change?
Ack
This is going to break the rainier and everest flow. say the systemVpdBackupPath will be empty or N/A on rainier and everest json. in that case, why we need to log a PEL?
No, it won't break the existing flow for rainier & Everest, you are confused with the if statement ending.
How can you say that the backup vpd has default value in PEL, when the backup vpd doesn't exist.
Ack
you can print the errorMsg and also print "System VPD backup and restore failed. Continue collecting system VPD.."
Ack

wherever required, please avoid using the term hardware for both primary/backup.
instead make use of the terms primaryVPD and backupVPD.
Ack
I don't prefer catching all the exceptions here at restoreSystemVPD() just to handle errors in backup vpd. we need to discuss on this.
Ack
I would like to have this in a separate api. Lets be cautious to have minimal editions in the existing apis.
Ack

again I can see you pointing a wrong PEL interface here. you log the error as Record doesn't exist. but your pel interface says that the vpd has default value :)
can you please log the appropriate interface here.
Ack
please add "a" to backup.
Ack
Why do you need a variable and set it again and again. return true/false in-place
Ack
Why this variable is required.
Ack
If it stores the primary data, why it is called back up path?
It will store the system backplane's critical data as a backup on EEPROM file hence the name. I have corrected explanation that will give appropriate meaning.
Ack
Inventory object path of what?
Ack
Proper name.
I feel this is the suitable name, as this will have the EEPROM file path on which the system VPD's critical keywords will be stored as backup.
My concern was with the spelling of "backup" which has been taken care in latest PS. Hence marking as resolved.
Again, Why there is a need to pass this parameter?

As discussed, I am passing this because we need that pointer object in order to de-allocate the memory in case of any exceptions. Once the exceptions are handled Caller has make sure the pointer is deleted. I have mentioned that point in doxygen (Caller has to make sure of deleting the pointer object).
Please use proper name.
I feel this is the suitable name, as this will have the EEPROM file path on which the system VPD's critical keywords will be stored as backup.
My concern was with the "backup" part which has been taken care hence resolving the comment.
Since this function returns a bool, you could have directly evaluated it inside the "if" condition, saving an extra variable, a copy and a comparison.
Ack
No need of this variable.
Ack
Is there a need for this?
Not really, thought of printing the error message for developer reference while analyzing the logs
we can't flood the journal. Pel is already there for reference.
Ack
There is no gain by not using "a" in Backup?
Ack
Please add some explanation against these variables.
Ack
Why are you declaring the object pointer here and why do you want to pass this to the parseVpdFile API?

As discussed, I am passing this because we need that pointer object in order to de-allocate the memory in case of any exceptions. Once the exceptions are handled Caller has make sure the pointer is deleted. I have mentioned that point in doxygen (Caller has to make sure of deleting the pointer object).

The comment no longer holds good as with the latest change pointer can be taken care without passing around.
Marking as resolved.
We already have this check at line 1596 where we are setting pel severity. We can avoid string comparison here?
Ack
I am a bit doubtful here. How do we know that the failure is while parsing backup file VPD or system VPD?

yeah correct we can't say because of which file failure occurred here, we need to handle general exceptions locally for base panel vpd. But anyway we don't take any action for both system VPD & pase panel VPD files inside postActionFail() as they don't have 'postActionFail' flag in vpd json file. we can add handling of general exception locally for base panel VPD.
Do you have to pass inventory path as parameter? Can we extract that here in the function definition?
Can be extracted inside this function, but before this function call we already  doing the extraction of inventory path, hence thought of passing as parameter instead of repeating same piece of code.
The same code is repeated in "getVpdDataInVector" can we make use of that here?

Can be done, but it requires adding an extra argument to the getVpdDataInVector() in order to get the offset value, so which will impact at many places as getVpdDataInVector() is used in other places & files as well. So Lets keep as it is I feel.
Why this object needs to be passed as parameter to the function?

As discussed, I am passing this because we need that pointer object in order to de-allocate the memory in case of any exceptions. Once the exceptions are handled Caller has make sure the pointer is deleted. I have mentioned that point in doxygen (Caller has to make sure of deleting the pointer object).
Don't include namespace at this scope in header files. Please follow the guidelines for newly added code.
Ack
Please make this api as class member function. Also I see a common code being used in multiple files. Can we move that to utils?
For time being I am not addressing this comment because as per our latest discussion we don't need any changes in vpd-manager.
If you are passing class member as reference, remove it from a static method. Make it a class member function.
For time being I am not addressing this comment because as per our latest discussion we don't need any changes in vpd-manager.
Proper name.
I feel this is the suitable name, as this will have the EEPROM file path on which the system VPD's critical keywords will be stored as backup.
Why do you need to pass this?

As discussed, I am passing this because we need that pointer object in order to de-allocate the memory in case of any exceptions. Once the exceptions are handled Caller has make sure the pointer is deleted. I have mentioned that point in doxygen (Caller has to make sure of deleting the pointer object).
The statement is wrong. We are able to parse the VPD. Its just that we are not interested in that type here.
Ack
What about data exception?

I think it is not required because in the current code  we are not handling even any exception for system vpd parsing. Here I have added exception handling for ECC because we have to exit the process if there are ECC exception found while parsing of base panel VPD. As discussed initially we need to exit the vpd-tool process in below cases: 1) base panel EEPROM file path doesn't exist 2) VSBK record not present in the EEPROM file 3) If there are any ECC exceptions found in base panel vpd parsing.

This re-typing is not required. Type of variable need not be specific so "DbusPropertyMap" term is ok and variable name can explain the specific requirement of that value. So variable name is ok in this case.
Ack
If record is not found pel is logged but if keyword is not found only standard logging? Is that ok?

For time being I have kept the error logging, need to check with Priyanga since she was checking with hardware engineer regarding the PEL severity. Once hardware engineers confirms we can create a PEL with severity suggested by them.
In that case log a pel with the same severity as of record. Later can be updated.
Ack
Not required.
Ack
Please rephrase, the path backs up the system VPD.
Ack
inventory path is of the FRU.
Ack
there is nothing called VPD inventory.
Ack
nit: Why 'B' is capital?
Ack
Dont need to return any value from this function.Just compare the map for empty after call.
Ack
Not required.
Ack
Dont need these couts.
Ack
Cout not required.
Ack
Why this check is needed before dumping the file?

It is because of below mentioned reasons:
1)We will not have base panel vpd data to dump here since the parsing of base panel VPD we are doing inside restoreSystemVPD by calling getBackupVpdInMap(). 
2)Jinu was mentioned in of the discussions that, we are not doing anything with this dumped VPD file so it is of no use. Hence thought of keeping the existing code under check to dump the system VPD only not the base panel VPD.

we can discuss if not clear

> Hence thought of keeping the existing code under check to dump the system VPD only not the base panel VPD.

where are you dumping system VPD???
lets say code parses system VPD and systemVpdBackupPath is not empty. and if system VPD fails with ECC exception, will your code dump bad system vpd?

value of 'systemVpdBackupPath' will be empty because it is being fetched after parsing of system VPD file i.e after parseVpdFile() call. If there are any exceptions during parsing of system VPD the next statement after parseVpdFile() call won't get executed so control will directly goes to catch() block and take care of dumping the syste VPD because at that time value of 'systemVpdBackupPath' still be empty.

Types should be generic. Specific meaning should be provided by variable name.
So type "RecordName" is ok you can have variable name which gives specific meaning.

There are many pre-existing code which does that but we need to get rid of this going forward.

Its better to define a type only when the type is complex type else just use the standard type for defining the type and give variable name which gives specific meaning to the data that variable holds. Otherwise we will overly pollute the file.
Ack
DbusPropertyMap is sufficient here.
Ack
bonnell* spelling
Ack
can you please avoid using capitals in between the sentences unless its an abbreviation.
Ack
backup*
Ack
review pending. posting the comments which I have so far

50004000.json present in upstream is not up-to-date. please create a downstream PR for the json changes.

Remove this change here.
okay..

The map also has records?
Parsed VPD map will be fine I guess.
Ack
You are already including this namespace at the top. Get rid from one of the place.
Ack
You are including this at the top of file. Get rid from the top.
Ack
VPD itself os vital product data.
Ack

Try to keep the function generic so that it can be reused if required in future.
Let the function be just getKwValue which reads kwd value from a map and returns true/false based on result.
Ack

These two parameters are just required for logging PEL.
Can be avoided by logging PEL at the caller. 
Let the API just return true/false based on wether it was able to read the value or not and caller decide what to do in that case.
Ack
Use a default value here.
Ack

I can see you are fetching these two values systemVpdBackupPath and backupVpdInvPath in 3 apis. (in main, in populate dbus and in restore system vpd apis). Can you fetch once in main and pass it as arguments wherever required?

These two parameters we are being used only during the system VPD parsing & restoring of system VPD so lets fetch as and when required instead of polluting the populateDbus() argument list because in other cases we won't be using these parameters.
IMO, fetching from JSON is constant time action, since only few values, I am ok with the code here.
can you print cerr stating - "Unable to fetch backup VPD <eeprom path>. Skip system VPD restore."
Not needed because we already creating the PEL inside getBackupVpdInMap().
Is it possible that file is present still the parsed map comes out to be empty?
No. If any exceptions during parsing control will not come here it will hit catch() block if no exceptions means map will not be empty.
Log PELs here if required. Also I would like to take an opinion on should we log PEL for record/kwd not found.
we already logging the PEL inside getKwValue() before returning false if the record/kw is not found.

I know, that is why in my comment I told to make that function generic so that it can be used if required in future.
Also, a function to get value should just get the value if there is any error or failure caller should take the call if it requires a PEL or something else.
Ack
Since the logic has changed above, please update the comment for the line as well.
Ack

Use a parameter with default value in the "restoreSystemVPD" api. This way
1) You will avoid change in the existing code.
2) Get rid of this variable.
Ack
no need of this boolean.  stated the reason below
No it should be here only. Please take a look at explanation given below

can you please move(1930 till 1939) this inside the if at line 1799. and you can move the if at line 1799 anywhere after line 1846.

no need of the boolean isSystemVpd.

The intent of putting this piece of code here, I want to fetch the 'systemVpdBackupPath' field value from JSON file only after successful parsing of system VPD. This is because if we fetch at above and keep it ready means in a scenario if there are ECC/VPD data exceptions occurs during system VPD parser it will hit the catch() blocks so in those cases we may end up in choosing the wrong baseFruInventoryPath & VPD file path hence this piece of code is being written here instead of above.

what happens when the system VPD itself has any ECC errors? where do you capture it?

Is it always the backup vpd going to fail?

'systemVpdBackupPath' will be empty if there are any ECC exceptions occurred because we are fetching 'systemVpdBackupPath' after the parseVpdFile() of system VPD. If any exceptions ECC/VPD data exceptions occurred inside parseVpdFile()  the next statement after parseVpdFile() call won't be executed so value of 'systemVpdBackupPath' will empty in those case hence it will capture the system VPD failure details
same here, what happens when the system VPD itself has any data exceptions? where do you capture it?
Same explanation as above
Get rid of this.
Ack
There was a comment to change this. You marked the comment as resolved but I don't see a change here.

These two parameters are no more as arguments to function. Below was the comment
"These two parameters are just required for logging PEL.
Can be avoided by logging PEL at the caller."
Can we use recursive call here to populate Dbus instead of creating a new function?

Lets discuss with Jinu on this and decide. Keeping the following disadvantages of recursive functions I would prefer not to go with recursive call.

1. Recursive functions are generally slower than non-recursive function.
2. It may require a lot of memory space to hold intermediate results on the system stacks.
3. Hard to analyze or understand the code.
4. It is not more efficient in terms of space and time complexity.
5. The computer may run out of memory if the recursive calls are not properly checked.

If code duplication is the concern we can add the appropriate checks and make use of existing code instead of recursive function and need to take care of all the test scenarios.
Need to revisit the code for optimization.
